{{Infobox military unit |unit_name =14th Special Forces Division |native_name= |image=[[File:Syrian commando.png|200px]] |caption=Syrian Special Forces Patch |dates= early 1990s – present |country={{flag|Syria}} |allegiance=[[File:Coat of arms of Syria.svg|20px]] [[Syrian Government]] |command_structure= |branch={{flagicon image|Flag of the Syrian Arab Army.svg}} [[Syrian Army]] |type= Division |specialization= [[Light Infantry]] |size= 3 regiments |garrison=[[Damascus]] |commander1_label=Current Commander |commander1= |commander2= |commander2_label=Reserve Bureau Commander |commander3_label=Brigade Commanders |commander3= |nickname= |motto= |colors= |march= |mascot= |equipment= |equipment_label= |battles=[[Lebanese Civil War]]
[[Syrian uprising (2011–present)|Syrian Civil War]]
*[[Siege of Homs]] |notable_commanders = Maj.Gen. [[Ali Haydar]]
Maj.Gen. [[Bassel al-Assad]] |anniversaries = |identification_symbol= }} {{command structure |name=14th Special Forces Division |date=February 2013 |parent= |subordinate= * 36th 'Special Forces' Regiment * 554th 'Special Forces' Regiment * 556th 'Special Forces' Regiment }} The '''14th Special Forces Division''' is a division of the [[Syrian Armed Forces]] specializing in [[light infantry]] operations. ==Role== Syrians use the term 'Special Forces' to describe the 14th, [[15th Special Forces Division|15th]] divisions, as well as the independent 'special forces' regiments, but they more closely resemble conventional light infantry units, than [[Western culture|Western]] [[Special Forces]] in both mission and composition. The term Special Forces has been applied ostensibly because of their specialized training in [[airborne forces|airborne]] and [[air assault]] operations, but they should be regarded as light infantry forces and elite only in relation to the [[conventional]] armored and mechanized brigades of the [[Syrian Army]].http://www.understandingwar.org/sites/default/files/SyrianArmy-DocOOB.pdf ==History== [[File:General Ali Haidar.jpg|thumb|left|Maj.Gen. Ali Haidar, the father of Syrian special forces.]] Women special military forces from the [[Defense Companies (Syria)|Defense Companies]] in the '70s and early '80s ate live snakes as part of their training while children being training in paramilitary activities were trained to stab live puppies to death.{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1364357/Rumsfelds-bizarre-gift-Saddam-Video-Syrian-atrocities.html |title=Rumsfeld's bizarre gift from Saddam: Video of Syrian 'atrocities' |website=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2011-03-09 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=db9_1299782229 |title=Syrian Snake-Eating Girls and Puppy Stranglers |website=LiveLeak.com |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dT-OPCDYolU |title=Syrian Dictator Hafez al-Assad's army biting snakes killing animals. |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-03-10 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mI_3lW45MXA |title=Syrian TV from 1984 - Female Soldiers Eating Live Snakes, President Assad in Audience, April 3, 2012 |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6j5bu_vlTc |title=Syrian Girls eating snakes alive (Rifaat's commandos) |publisher=YouTube |date=2012-04-03 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=a10_1370454339 |title=Syrian military girls biting snakes showing Hafez Assad their courage |website=LiveLeak.com |date=2012-06-18 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.military.com/video/operations-and-strategy/terrorism/snake-eating-girls-and-puppy-stranglers/822793569001 |title=GRAPHIC: Snake-Eating Soldier Girls |website=Military.com |date=2011-03-11 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=a10_1370454339&comments=1 |title=Syrian military girls biting snakes showing Hafez Assad their courage (comments) |website=LiveLeak.com |date=2012-06-18 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=d57_1387158920 |title=Syrian soldiers biting the heads off snakes, killing puppies |website=LiveLeak.com |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.liveleak.com/view?i=d57_1387158920&comments=1 |title=Syrian soldiers biting the heads off snakes, killing puppies (comments) |website=LiveLeak.com |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PrjYyVFlawk |title=سرايا الدفاع سورية |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-05-16 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zchdPE8xMC0 |title=سرايا الدفاع السورية سلاح السفاح رفعت |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-03-09 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X9wXKlktdKI |title=YouTube |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vd7IhWKrGjs |title=Syrian Dictator Hafez al-Assad Bizarre Army Parade |publisher=YouTube |date=2011-03-08 |accessdate=2016-01-08}}{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T6j5bu_vlTc |title=Syrian Girls eating snakes alive (Rifaat's commandos) |publisher=YouTube |date=2012-04-03 |accessdate=2016-01-08}} Syrian special forces also ate live scorpions, live snakes, and live puppies during training.{{cite web|url=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ciIxsapx_Fk |title=syrian special force eating snake scorpion الجيش السوري القوات الخاصة |publisher=YouTube |date=2009-05-04 |accessdate=2016-01-08}} Syrian soldiers are also trained to handle vipers.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=alHN9CffWAY |title=Syrian soldiers dominate all snakes: vipers and terrorist |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2016-01-08}} The 14th Special Forces Division was established to command three Special Forces Regiments after the mid 1990s restructuring of [[Ali Haydar]]’s consolidated Special Forces Command.http://www.understandingwar.org/sites/default/files/TheAssadRegime-web.pdf Haydar's Special Forces expanded in size to 25,000 men, and formed a key part of the Syrian government's security apparatus. The Special Forces were trained in [[airborne infantry|airborne operations]], and were rivaled on power only by the [[Defense Companies]] controlled by Hafez's brother, [[Rifaat al-Assad|Rifaat]]. As such, the 14th Division became a strong counter-weight to the Defense Companies, as both these formations were largely [[airborne infantry|airborne division]]s. Traditionally they are recruited from the [[Alawite]] sect to ensure loyalty to the government. Intelligence sources state it is likely that such units are involved in crushing popular dissent and neutralizing ringleaders.{{cite web|url=http://www.channel4.com/news/syrias-army-holds-the-key-to-assad-regimes-future|title=Syria's army holds the key to Assad regime's future|work=Channel 4 News}} ==Syrian occupation of Lebanon== Under Haydar, the Special Forces units were deployed to Lebanon as part of the [[Syrian occupation of Lebanon|Syrian intervention]] in the [[Lebanese Civil War]]. During the war they engaged with [[Palestine Liberation Organization|PLO]] units under the command of [[Yasser Arafat]].{{cite book |last=Sami M. |first=Moubayed |authorlink= |title=Steel and Silk |url= |accessdate= |year=2006 |publisher=Cune Press |location= |isbn= |page=55}} ==Syrian Civil War== The government committed much of the 14th Special Forces Division to the assault of [[Homs]], in which it fought some of the strongest rebel positions of Homs’ southwest [[Baba Amr]], [[Inshaat]], and Jobar neighborhoods. Opposition reports specifically cited activity from the 556th Special Forces Regiment, but most frequently cited the 14th Special Forces Division generally. Activity was reported in different parts of the city during similar time-frames, suggesting that at least one additional regiment from the 14th Special Forces was involved in the Homs operation. ==See also== *[[15th Special Forces Division]] *[[Al-Assad family]] *[[4th Armoured Division (Syria)|4th Armored Division]] *[[Republican Guard (Syria)|Republican Guard]] ==References== {{Reflist|}} [[Category:Divisions of Syria]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in the 1990s]] [[Category:Special forces units and formations]] [[Category:Damascus]]
